title: Market report: Brexit disquiet buffets London markets
text:
Brexit news dominated traders’ attention on a quiet day for company updates, with only Asos making much of a splash on the stock markets.

Sterling was whipped back and forth by headlines and tweets during the London session, as whispers emerged from close-to-deadline talks between UK and EU negotiators.

It stayed positive from early afternoon onwards despite a slide in the morning after London traders arrived at their desks.

The currency re-established four-month highs against the dollar in the lead up to the closing bell, and hit a new five-month high against the euro, continuing a resurgence in strength that began late last week.

The rising currency put pressure on the FTSE 100, with internationally...
description: Brexit news dominated traders’ attention on a quiet day for company updates, with only Asos making much of a splash on the stock markets.
